means: 珍爱( cherish的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: In the last 30 years many cherished values have bitten the dust.
sentence.Network_cn: 在过去的30年中，许多珍贵的价值观已经消失殆尽。

sentence.Network_en: He described the picture as his most cherished possession.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说那幅画是他最珍爱的财产。

sentence.Network_en: Freud called into question some deeply cherished beliefs.
sentence.Network_cn: 弗洛伊德对人们先前深信不疑的一些观念提出了质疑。

PerfectNetExp.abs: old man cherished the girl as if she were his daughter ., 老人很疼爱那女孩子 , 就像亲生女儿一样.
He still cherished the illusion of power and consequence when the reality had gone ., 当现实情况消逝时 , 他依然眷恋于权势和个人影响的幻想.
cherimoya 秘鲁番荔枝, cherished 怀着, cherini 凯里尼
For years she cherished the hope that her husband might still be alive ., 多年来 , 她一直抱有她的丈夫可能仍活在人世的希望.

list.abs: 珍惜的英文翻译，珍惜用英语怎么说 -... ... 懂得珍惜 to treasure 好好珍惜 to cherish.
每日一词_百度知道 ... cherish justice 坚持正义 cherished desire 夙愿 cherish a deep love for 热爱.
&quot;心&quot;字组词_百度知道 ... ▲心愿[ cherished desire;aspiration;dream;wish] ▲心悦诚服[ be completely convinced].
英文单词珍惜咋拼写_百度知道 ... cherish a grudge against 对...怀恨 cherish justice 坚持正义 cherished desire 夙愿.
cherishes the cife是什么意思?... ... Cherish one's family 珍爱家庭 cherish life 珍爱生命 cherish each other 彼此珍爱.
... 3:Chengdu-Kunming railway 成昆铁路 4:cherish life 珍惜生命 5:cherish the hard-won situation 珍惜来之不易的局面.

entry.tran: 怀有，抱有(希望);怀念(过去)
entry.def: If you cherish something such as a hope or a pleasant memory, you keep it in your mind for a long period of time.

example.ex: The president will cherish the memory of this visit to Ohio...
example.tran: 总统将铭记这次俄亥俄之行。

example.ex: It was a wonderful occasion which we will cherish for many years to come.
example.tran: 那是一个美好的时刻，我们将多年不忘。

entry.def: If you cherish someone or something, you take good care of them because you love them.

example.ex: He genuinely loved and cherished her...
example.tran: 他由衷地爱恋并珍惜她。

example.ex: The previous owners had cherished the house.
example.tran: 房子先前的主人非常爱惜这房子。

entry.tran: 珍视，维护，捍卫(权利、特权或原则)
entry.def: If you cherish a right, a privilege, or a principle, you regard it as important and try hard to keep it.

example.ex: These people cherish their independence and sovereignty.
example.tran: 这些人民珍视他们的独立和主权。

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by feeling or showing fond affection for;
2. thought of and clung to fondly or reverentially

auth_sentence.content: The loss of something I had loved and cherished.
auth_sentence.res_content: The loss of something I had loved and cherished.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The loss of something I had loved and cherished.

auth_sentence.content: Why is one species cherished while another is spurned?
auth_sentence.res_content: Why is one species cherished while another is spurned?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why is one species cherished while another is spurned?

auth_sentence.content: They'd thought nothing of rejecting what he cherished.
auth_sentence.res_content: They'd thought nothing of rejecting what he cherished.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They'd thought nothing of rejecting what he cherished.
